unnormalised: ## New Wheels in Town, Yaar! Automotive Launches Heating Up!
normalised: ## New Wheels in Town, Yaar! Automotive Launches Heating Up!

unnormalised: Namaste, petrolheads! The automotive scene is sizzling hotter than a plate of momos in Delhi winter! We've seen a flurry of vehicle launches lately, enough to make your head spin faster than a Maruti 800 on the ghats.
normalised: Namaste, petrolheads! The automotive scene is sizzling hotter than a plate of momos in Delhi winter! We've seen a flurry of vehicle launches lately, enough to make your head spin faster than a Maruti eight hundred on the ghats.

unnormalised: First up, remember that teaser from Mahindra? Turns out, it wasn't just hot air. They've finally unveiled the all-new XUV700 in a dazzling ceremony near Pune. Expect aggressive styling and loads of tech - think connected car features and maybe even autonomous driving, who knows? Early reports suggest a starting price around Rs. 15 Lakhs, which is seriously competitive.
normalised: First up, remember that teaser from Mahindra? Turns out, it wasn't just hot air. They've finally unveiled the all-new X U V seven hundred in a dazzling ceremony near Pune. Expect aggressive styling and loads of tech - think connected car features and maybe even autonomous driving, who knows? Early reports suggest a starting price around rupee fifteen lakh, which is seriously competitive.

unnormalised: Then there's Tata, keeping the momentum going with refreshed versions of the Nexon and Harrier. The Nexon gets some cosmetic tweaks to keep it looking fresh against the competition like Kia Sonet. The Harrier, on the other hand, seems to be getting a serious infotainment upgrade. Both aiming for more mileage I hear, crucial in these times of rising petrol costs.
normalised: Then there's Tata, keeping the momentum going with refreshed versions of the Nexon and Harrier. The Nexon gets some cosmetic tweaks to keep it looking fresh against the competition like Kia Sonet. The Harrier, on the other hand, seems to be getting a serious infotainment upgrade. Both aiming for more mileage I hear, crucial in these times of rising petrol costs.

unnormalised: But the real buzz is around electric vehicles. Ola Electric is still hogging the limelight with its scooters, but we're also seeing established players like Bajaj and TVS ramping up their EV game. Bangalore is becoming quite the hub for EV innovation, isn’t it?
normalised: But the real buzz is around electric vehicles. Ola Electric is still hogging the limelight with its scooters, but we're also seeing established players like Bajaj and T V S ramping up their E V game. Bangalore is becoming quite the hub for E V innovation, isn’t it?

unnormalised: Speaking of innovation, some engineering students from IIT Madras are reportedly working on a solar-powered rickshaw. Remember the movie *Rocket Boys*? Seems like inspiration is flowing everywhere. Imagine cruising through Chennai in a completely emission-free auto rickshaw!
normalised: Speaking of innovation, some engineering students from I I T Madras are reportedly working on a solar-powered rickshaw. Remember the movie *Rocket Boys*? Seems like inspiration is flowing everywhere. Imagine cruising through Chennai in a completely emission-free auto rickshaw!

unnormalised: So, what's next? More SUVs? More EVs? Affordable motorcycles? The possibilities are endless! Keep your eyes peeled for more updates. This year is shaping up to be a cracker for the Indian automotive industry! Let us know in the comments which launch got YOU excited!
normalised: So, what's next? More S U Vs? More E Vs? Affordable motorcycles? The possibilities are endless! Keep your eyes peeled for more updates. This year is shaping up to be a cracker for the Indian automotive industry! Let us know in the comments which launch got YOU excited!
